Object.Field:
COMPONENT NAME: IKM Teradata Multi-Statement
AUTHOR: Oracle
DESCRIPTION Integrates data in Teradata database target table using multi statement requests, managed in one SQL transacation. Typical use cases are: - parallel execution of simple interfaces - improve Teradata performance by synchronized scans - improve Teradata performance by avoiding transient journal Data integration is performed directly without integration table. So data control is not available. Allows Inserts and Updates Multi-Statement is commited after successful execution
REQUIREMENTS - Interfaces using this KM must be used from within a package: - The first interface in the package loading one of table via the multi-statement must have INIT_MULTI_STATEMENT=YES. - Each subsequence interface loading a table via the multi-statement must use this KM and have INIT_MULTI_STATEMENT=NO. - The last interface must have EXECUTE=YES in order to run the generated multi-statement. - You specify the type of statement using the STATEMENT_TYPE option for each interface. - You specify the type of statement using the SQL_OPTION option for each interface. This option is added at the end of the INSERT or UPDATE.
OPTIONS (Refer to Option descriptions for more information on each option) - INIT_MULTI_STATEMENT: Initialize list of statements? To be set to Yes on first interface of group only - STATEMENT_TYPE: Insert or update statement - EXECUTE: Execute insert/update commands? To be set to Yes on last interface of group - SQL_OPTION: Additional SQL sentence that is added at the end of the query, for example QUALIFY Clause. Can contain odiRef api. - DELETE_ALL : Delete all rows from target table prior to execution? - REPORT_NB_ROWS: Report detailed row counts for each target table. The detail report is issues in the error message of the "Execution Report" task of the last interface. This task always complete in Warning state.
LIMITATIONS - Multi Statements are only supported as part of a package - Temporary indexes are not supported - Updates are considered as Inserts in terms of row count - Updates can only have a single DataSet - Only executing interface (EXECUTE = YES) reports row counts - Journalized source data not supported - Neither FlowControl nor StaticControl is supported - SQL_OPTION applies to last DataSet only
Check this option for the interface corresponding to the first INSERT or UPDATE statement of the multi statement. This interface should be executed first within a package.
Statement Type : - I = Insert - U = Update
Check this option for the interface corresponding to the last INSERT or UPDATE statement of the multi statement. This interface should be executed last within a package.

Use this option to add specific or complementary SQL syntax at the end of the statement, for exemple a QUALIFY Clause. This text can contain odiRef API calls.
Examples: QUALIFY RANK() OVER (ORDER BY sumprice DESC) <=100 SAMPLE 0.10
Check this option if you wish to delete the content of the target datastore.

Use this option to report the detail row count for each table impacted by the multi-insert. This option only applies to interfaces with the EXECUTE option set to YES. The detail report is issues in the error message of the "Execution Report" task of the last interface. Note that this task always complete in Warning state.

<% if (odiRef.getOption("REPORT_NB_ROWS").equals("1")) { %>raise OdiKMException("ODIKM-STDKM-IKM-10079", "ODIKM-STDKM-IKM-10079: This is no error message. This is message reports the execution results:

 {0} 
",[report]) <% };%>

<%

// Some Declarations
String nl = ""+(char)10;

if (sqlBuffer == void) {
 	%>raise OdiKMException("ODIKM-TD-IKM-10001", "ODIKM-TD-IKM-10001: Trying to add statement, but MultiStatements has not been initialized, yet. Please use Initilaize Multi Statement option on first interface.") <%
} else

if (odiRef.getDataSetCount() > 1 && odiRef.getOption("STATEMENT_TYPE").equals("U")) {
 	%>raise OdiKMException("ODIKM-TD-IKM-10002", "ODIKM-TD-IKM-10002: Statement Type Update only supports single Source DataSet") <%
} else

// --------------------------------
// Building INSERT statement
// --------------------------------
if (odiRef.getOption("STATEMENT_TYPE").equals("I")) {
	StringBuffer Query = new StringBuffer();
	Query.append( "insert into	" + odiRef.getTable("L","TARG_NAME","A") + nl );
	Query.append( "(" +nl ); 
	Query.append( "	" + odiRef.getColList("", "[COL_NAME]", ",\n\t", "", "(INS and REW)") +nl );
	Query.append( ") " +nl );
	for (int i=0; i < odiRef.getDataSetCount(); i++) {
		Query.append( odiRef.getDataSet(i, "Operator") +nl );
		Query.append( "select	" + odiRef.getPop("DISTINCT_ROWS") +nl);
		Query.append( "	" + odiRef.getColList(i, "", "[EXPRESSION]", ",\n\t", "", "") +nl);
		Query.append( "from	" + odiRef.getFrom(i) +nl ); 
		{ 
			s = ""; 
			if (odiRef.getDataSet(i, "HAS_JRN").equals("1")) { 
				s+= "where	JRN_FLAG <> 'D'";
			} else { 
				s+="where	(1=1)";
			}; 
			s+=(char)10+odiRef.getJoin(i);
			s+=(char)10+odiRef.getFilter(i);
			s+=(char)10+odiRef.getJrnFilter(i);
			/* For Performance: suppress where clause, if empty */ 
			if (!s.trim().equals("where	(1=1)")) { Query.append( s ); }; 
		};
		Query.append( odiRef.getGrpBy(i) + nl);
		Query.append( odiRef.getHaving(i) +nl);
	}; // DataSet loop
	Query.append( odiRef.getOption("SQL_OPTION") );

	// Insert semicolon except for very first command
	sqlBuffer.append ( sqlBuffer.length()==0 ? "" : nl+"; " );
	// Append new command
	sqlBuffer.append (Query.toString());

} else

// --------------------------------
// Building UPDATE statement
// --------------------------------
if (odiRef.getOption("STATEMENT_TYPE").equals("U")) {
	StringBuffer Query = new StringBuffer();	
	Query.append( "update	T" +nl );
	Query.append( "from	" + odiRef.getTable("L", "TARG_NAME", "A") + " as T, " +nl );
	Query.append( "(" +nl );
	for (int i=0; i < odiRef.getDataSetCount(); i++) {
		Query.append( odiRef.getDataSet(i, "Operator") +nl );
		Query.append( "select	" + odiRef.getPop("DISTINCT_ROWS") +nl);
		Query.append( "	" + odiRef.getColList(i, "", "[EXPRESSION]\t[COL_NAME]", ",\n\t", "", "!TRG") +nl);
		Query.append( "from	" + odiRef.getFrom(i) +nl ); 
		{ 
			s = ""; 
			if (odiRef.getDataSet(i, "HAS_JRN").equals("1")) { 
				s+= "where	JRN_FLAG <> 'D'";
			} else { 
				s+="where	(1=1)";
			}; 
			s+=(char)10+odiRef.getJoin(i);
			s+=(char)10+odiRef.getFilter(i);
			s+=(char)10+odiRef.getJrnFilter(i);
			/* For Performance: suppress where clause, if empty */ 
			if (!s.trim().equals("where	(1=1)")) { Query.append( s ); }; 
		};
		Query.append( odiRef.getGrpBy(i) );
		Query.append( odiRef.getHaving(i) );
		Query.append( odiRef.getOption("SQL_OPTION") );
	}; // DataSet loop
	Query.append( ") S" +nl );
	Query.append( "set 	" +nl);
	Query.append( odiRef.getColList("\t", "[COL_NAME]\t= S.[COL_NAME]", ",\n\t", "", "(((UPD and !UK) and !TRG) and REW)") );
	Query.append( "	" + odiRef.getColList(
				odiRef.getColList(",\n\t", " ", "", "", "(((UPD and !UK) and !TRG) and REW)").trim() + "\n\t",
				"[COL_NAME]\t= [EXPRESSION]", ",\n\t", "", "(((UPD and !UK) and TRG) and REW)") +nl);
	Query.append( "where	" + odiRef.getColList("(",  "T.[COL_NAME]\t= S.[COL_NAME]", "\n\tand ", ")", "(UK)") +nl);
	Query.append( "	" +nl);
	Query.append( "	/* only changed rows */" +nl);
	Query.append( "	" + odiRef.getColList("and (\n\t\t",  "(S.[COL_NAME] <> T.[COL_NAME] or S.[COL_NAME]  is null or T.[COL_NAME]  is null )", " \n\t\tor ", "\n\t)", "((UPD and !TRG) and !UK) ") +nl);

	// Insert semicolon except for very first command
	sqlBuffer.append ( sqlBuffer.length()==0 ? "" : nl+"; " );
	// Append new command
	sqlBuffer.append (Query.toString());

} else
{
 	%>raise OdiKMException("ODIKM-STDKM-10000", "ODIKM-STDKM-10000: Invalid value \"{0}\" for option \"STATEMENT_TYPE\". Only values I and U are supported",["<%=odiRef.getOption ("STATEMENT_TYPE")%>"]) <%
};
%>
# Adding DML

from java.lang import Class from java.sql import Connection, DriverManager, Statement, SQLException from java.io import StringWriter, PrintWriter
ExecSql = r"""<%=sqlBuffer%>""" + ";"
report = ""
try: # Get Dest Connection Info con = odiRef.getJDBCConnection("DEST"); try: # Set autocommit false con.setAutoCommit(0) # Create a statement object from active connection stmt = con.createStatement() try: stmt.clearBatch() totalRows = 0 error = 0 firstRes = 0 # Use Statement.execute method to execute a multi-statement firstRes = stmt.execute(ExecSql) # If a ResultSet has been generated, error if (firstRes>0): raise OdiKMException("ODIKM-TD-IKM-10003", "ODIKM-TD-IKM-10003: IllegalStateException, Unexpected results: ResultSet generated") else: # Continue processing and display errors, if any count = 0; # processed command counter # While there are more update counts to process updResult = stmt.getUpdateCount() while not(updResult == -1): count +=1 if ((updResult >= 0) or (updResult == -2)): report += " Command %d executed successfully. %d row(s) treated.
" % (count,updResult) if updResult > 0: totalRows += updResult else: report += " Command %d failed to execute successfully. Result is %d
" % (count,updResult) error = 1 # Set error flag break # Retrieve next result if (stmt.getMoreResults()): # a ResultSet has been generated - error raise OdiKMException("ODIKM-TD-IKM-10004", "ODIKM-TD-IKM-10004: IllegalStateException, Unexpected results: ResultSet generated. Command {0} failed to execute successfully. Result is {1}", [count,updResult]) # get next UpdateCount updResult = stmt.getUpdateCount() if (error>0): # If an error was present, fail raise OdiKMException("ODIKM-STDKM-10010", "ODIKM-STDKM-10010: IllegalStateException, Error occured during command execution. Command {0} failed to execute successfully. Result is {1}", [count,updResult]) else: # All statements have been processed successfully, can commit all changes to the database con.commit() odiRef.setNbRows(totalRows) odiRef.setNbInsert(totalRows) finally: # Close the statement stmt.close() finally: # Connection is closed by ODI agent con.close() pass
except SQLException, ex: # A SQLException was generated. Catch it and display the error information # Note that there could be multiple error objects chained together report += "
*** SQLException caught ***
" report += "while submitting (error details are listed below DML):
" report += "_________________________
" report += ExecSql report += "_________________________
" while (ex is not None): report += " Error code: %d
" % ex.getErrorCode() report += " SQL State: %s
" % ex.getSQLState() report += " Message: %s
" % ex.getMessage() sw = StringWriter(); pw = PrintWriter(sw) #ex.printStackTrace(pw) report += sw.toString() report += "
" ex = ex.getNextException() raise OdiKMException("ODIKM-STDKM-IKM-10078", "ODIKM-STDKM-IKM-10078: {0}",[report])
<% if (1==1) { /* Deactivate in order to exclude DML from report */ %> report += "
DML submitted:
" report += "_________________________
" report += ExecSql report += "_________________________
" <%};%>
DEMO.IKM Teradata Multi Statement.Delete target table
DEMO.IKM Teradata Multi Statement.Initialize Multi Statement
DEMO.IKM Teradata Multi Statement.Run Multi Statement
